published_attributes.serialized_body:
This is a summary quiz that will help you consolidate knowledge from the whole-delivery content included in Junior's Academy (i.e. there will be no stack-specific questions included).

The goal of this quiz is to make sure that you understand the Netguru way of running projects. It covers selected points from the whole-delivery learning items and checks knowledge about the company and project work at Netguru.

The quiz has questions regarding the following sections from the Junior's Academy checklist: Netguru Culture, Project Intro, First Tasks, Project Work and Managing Self.

You will need 80% of correct answers to pass the test. If you get less that 80% - retake the quiz.

When you're done, go back to the next point on your Junior's Academy checklist.

An assessment process performed by our clients in accounts where we have full ownership on composition of the team

An assessment process performed by our clients in accounts where we have full ownership on composition of the team

published_attributes.title: Which team is responsible for supporting our project teams in product development activities?

draft_attributes.title: Which team is responsible for supporting our project teams in product development activities?

published_attributes.title: Which team works with our clients at the very beginning of the collaboration in order to, among other things, understand what a client needs and wants, understand their constraints and estimate the cost for the client?

draft_attributes.title: Which team works with our clients at the very beginning of the collaboration in order to, among other things, understand what a client needs and wants, understand their constraints and estimate the cost for the client?

answers.body: A team of Netguru employees whose task is to help the client build/develop a product
A team consisting for example of one Netguru employee and a team from the client's side whose common task is to help build/develop a product
A team consisting of Netguru employees whose job is to deliver tasks described in tickets provided by the client, no questions asked, no ownership over the final result taken

published_attributes.title: What is a project team in the context of Netguru? More than one answer may be correct.

answers.body: A team of Netguru employees whose task is to help the client build/develop a product
A team consisting for example of one Netguru employee and a team from the client's side whose common task is to help build/develop a product
A team consisting of Netguru employees whose job is to deliver tasks described in tickets provided by the client, no questions asked, no ownership over the final result taken

answers.definition: I care and I give feedback because I want to help you work things out.
I care but I donâ€™t give feedback because I donâ€™t want to hurt you.

answers.body: Tom, youâ€™re a good employee! Youâ€™re always ready to help the team out when there are fire situations. Last week, when there was a fire in our project, you took ownership and helped the team to put it down quickly and soothe things out with the client. Thanks for that! Thereâ€™s one thing I would recommend you to pay more attention to. In recent weeks you were late 3-4 times to team meetings. You might want to pay more attention to this as this may affect how people perceive you.
Your work is inefficient and in my opinion you should focus on it!

I love to work with you because you are the best!  Your jokes make everybody laugh. You do have some delays from time to time but itâ€™s not a problem because this is the beginning of your career! I also like to work with you because I can trust you!

published_attributes.title: Objectives, according to the OKR methodology, are ambitious and may feel somewhat uncomfortable

draft_attributes.title: Objectives, according to the OKR methodology, are ambitious and may feel somewhat uncomfortable

published_attributes.title: Key results, according to the OKR methodology, are measurable and should be easy to grade with a number

draft_attributes.title: Key results, according to the OKR methodology, are measurable and should be easy to grade with a number

published_attributes.title: When project OKRs are set and agreed by all parties, publish them in a place that is easily accessible for everyone involved in the project (e.g. Confluence space)

draft_attributes.title: When project OKRs are set and agreed by all parties, publish them in a place that is easily accessible for everyone involved in the project (e.g. Confluence space)

published_attributes.title: When planning sprints you should keep in mind your OKRs and think which tasks/activities will bring you closer to delivering specific Key Results and always prioritise the tasks that move you forward to delivering OKRs, which means delivering valuable product to the market.

draft_attributes.title: When planning sprints you should keep in mind your OKRs and think which tasks/activities will bring you closer to delivering specific Key Results and always prioritise the tasks that move you forward to delivering OKRs, which means delivering valuable product to the market.

answers.body: A 1-page business plan template created that helps deconstruct a business idea into its key assumptions
A business model that focuses on improving processes across the value stream in order to eliminate waste and deliver optimized value to the customer
An approach to managing an organization that supports the concept of continuous improvement

A business model that focuses on improving processes across the value stream in order to eliminate waste and deliver optimized value to the customer
An approach to managing an organization that supports the concept of continuous improvement

answers.body: Individuals and interactions over processes and tools
Responding to change over following a plan

answers.body: Individuals and interactions over processes and tools
Responding to change over following a plan

answers.body: Inspire individuals to work better in the future
Inspire the organization to change, to support all project teams better
Inspire the team to improve their cooperation until the end of the project
All of the answers are correct
